metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29912 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Requests initiated through reader mode did not properly omit cookies with a SameSite attribute. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox < 100.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
